business.headline: Sensex, Nifty closing: Top stocks that gained and lost on BSE, NSEIT and auto sector stocks dragged the market down. The fall in IT and auto stocks is linked to concerns over US reciprocal tariffs, which are set to come into effect on April 2.

Thailand stock exchange halts trading after earthquake hits MyanmarFollowing tremors from the Myanmar earthquake, the Stock Exchange of Thailand suspended all trading for the Friday afternoon session.

DA hiked by 2%: Here's how much central government employees will earn nowWith the 2% hike, DA has now risen from 53% to 55%. Pensioners will also experience a similar increase in their Dearness Relief (DR).

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

How India saw a billionaire boom in just 10 yearsIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

entertainment.headline: Will Smith addresses Chris Rock Oscars slap in new albumWill Smith's latest album, Based on a True Story, dives into the controversy surrounding his Oscars slap incident. During Oscars 2022, Will slapped Chris Rock when the latter cracked a joke on Will's wife, Jada Pinkett-Smith.

Chris Brown announces 2025 Breezy Bowl XX tour: Dates, tickets & moreChris Brown announces his 2025 Breezy Bowl XX Stadium Tour, celebrating 20 years in music. The tour spans Europe and North America, with tickets expected to sell out fast.

Megan Fox vs. Machine Gun Kelly: Who has the higher net worth Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly welcomed a baby girl amid their turbulent relationship. With MGK's $25 million fortune exceeding Megan's $8 million net worth, his music and investments give him the financial edge.

The Family Man 3: Manoj Bajpayee confirms Jaideep Ahlawat in cast, November releaseManoj Bajpayee has confirmed Jaideep Ahlawat's inclusion in The Family Man 3. He also said that the show will premiere on Prime Video in November.

Maren Morris' new single 'carry me through' kicks off Dreamsicle eraCountry star Maren Morris unveils Carry Me Through, a soulful anthem from her upcoming album Dreamsicle. Set for release on May 9, it follows a year of personal and artistic reinvention.
Kanye West sued for unauthorised sample after refusing clearance over antisemitismGerman singer Alice Merton sues Kanye West for using her song Blindside without permission in Gun to My Head.

Vikram's Veera Dheera Sooran release delay not due to financial issues: ProducerVeera Dheera Sooran's producer addressed the release delay of the film. He wrote on X how it was not due to financial issues.

Avengers Doomsday: Marvel's bet on nostalgia or beginning of another end-game?Avengers Infinity Saga - Infinity War and Endgame - had huge impact on cinema when they released. But will the upcoming Avengers film - Avengers Doomsday - hold the same effect?

Shivangi Joshi sends love to boyfriend Kushal Tandon on his 40th birthdayOn actor Kushal Tandon's birthday, his girlfriend Shivangi Joshi showered him with love through a heartfelt wish. The actor turned 40 on March 28.

Ananya Panday as Dilreet Gill in Akshay Kumar's Kesari 2. Makers share new postersActor Ananya Panday has been officially announced as part of the cast for the upcoming Hindi film Kesari Chapter 2. On Friday, the makers unveiled brand-new posters featuring Panday to make the announcement.

Mad Square review: A wacky fun sequel, but lacks the magic of MadReleased-Fri Mar 28, 2025Even before its release, Mad Square promised a laughter-packed ride without logic or intricate storytelling. While it delivers fun moments and retains the quirky energy of its prequel, the film struggles with inconsistent humour, underdeveloped character arcs, and a stretched second half.

Adolescence through Jamie Miller's eyes: Highs and lows of a teenager's emotionsNetflix's critically acclaimed show, 'Adolescence' portrays the layers of adolescence through its celebrated lead actor, teenager - debutante Owen Cooper. It is a tale of a street-smart thief and his antics to stop a drug-lord and save a village.

As anticipation builds, we take a look at the box office performances of his last five films.

The Glory to Weak Hero Class 1: Exploring bullying and its impact in K-dramasKorean dramas have been pivotal in showcasing the serious issue of bullying, exploring its effects on victims and society. Through powerful storytelling, these dramas address school violence, online harassment, and the emotional scars left behind.

Athiya Shetty shares glimpse of homecoming after embracing motherhoodAthiya Shetty and KL Rahul became parents of their first child, a daughter, on March 24. Athiya has shared a glimpse of their welcome ceremony on social media.
Where Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly stand after welcoming their baby girlMegan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly welcome their baby girl on March 27, 2025, months after ending their engagement.

Sikandar new song Hum Aapke Bina brings out Salman-Rashmika's chemistry. WatchThe team of 'Sikandar' released a romantic track from the film on Friday. Titled 'Hum Aapke Bina', it is sung by Arijit Singh, and highlights Salman Khan-Rashmika Mandanna's chemistry.

general news.headline: 144 dead in Myanmar after massive earthquake, buildings collapse in Thailand Live UpdatesA powerful earthquake and subsequent aftershocks struck Myanmar and neighbouring Thailand on Friday, killing several people and trapping dozens under rubble as multiple buildings collapsed.

RCB breach fortress Chepauk, clinch first win in Chennai in 17 yearsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru breached fortress Chepauk to make it two in the Indian Premier League 2025. Captain Patidar and the bowlers starred as the visitors clinched a clinical victory by 50 runs.

Family's quake horror atop swaying Bangkok high-rise as terrace pool overflowsA viral video captures a Korean family in a high-rise during Bangkok's tremors after Myanmar's earthquakes. Shaking rooftop pools created a waterfall illusion, amplifying panic before the family confirmed their safety.

Trump holds 'productive' talks with Carney, says meet planned after Canada pollsUS President Donald Trump has said he would meet Canadian PM Mark Carney after elections on April 28. His remarks came after he described a call between them as "productive".

Woman's decomposed body found in Delhi flat, landlord detained: SourcesThe body of the woman, who lived with her husband in the flat, was found wrapped in a blanket and stuffed inside a bag, which was hidden in a bed inside the house.

No gangrape in RG Kar case, probing larger conspiracy: CBI to courtThe rape and murder of a trainee doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College was not a gang rape but the act of a single perpetrator, Sanjay Roy, CBI informed the Calcutta High Court on Friday.

Anamika Khanna's AK | OK show is a love letter to the white shirtThe humble white shirt - albeit not in its humble form - took centre stage in AK | OK's new collection, Silver Collar, displayed at the Lakme Fashion Week.

Justice Varma's transfer cleared, High Court asked not to assign him judicial workFollowing the recovery of the cash pile from his residence during a fire incident last week, Justice Varma was repatriated from the Delhi High Court to the Allahabad High Court.

Pikachu electrifies Turkey protests, makes the world take noteProtesters in Turkey have taken to the streets against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after the arrest of his rival and Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu. The emergence of Pokemon character Pikachu at a protest site has made videos of the stir go viral. People across the globe are talking about the protest in Turkey now.

Google India finally reveals availability details for Pixel 9aGoogle has confirmed that the Pixel 9a will be available in India on April 16, alongside launches in Australia, Singapore, Taiwan, and Malaysia. The device will hit shelves earlier in the US, Canada, and UK on April 10.

Scissors left in woman's stomach during C-section, removed after 17 yearsA pair of scissors, left in a woman's stomach during a caesarean operation in 2008, was recovered after 17 years yesterday in Lucknow.

The lost grave of Dara Shikoh, murdered by brother AurangzebMughal emperor Aurangzeb got his brother Dara Shikoh beheaded in Delhi and presented his head to their father, Shah Jahan, whom he had imprisoned in Agra. Experts believe India's history would have been different had a scholarly and secular Dara become the emperor. Amid the controversy over Aurangzeb's grave, a look at the life of Dara, who translated the Upanishads into Persian, and the mystery around his tomb.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
